net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context

Class SumSimplifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.model.base.DefaultProxyVisitor
      • net.sourceforge.waters.model.module.DefaultModuleProxyVisitor
        • net.sourceforge.waters.model.compiler.context.SumSimplifier
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProxyVisitor, ModuleProxyVisitor

    public class SumSimplifier
extends DefaultModuleProxyVisitor

    A simplifier sub-task to normalise sums.

    The sum simplifier is invoked by the SimpleExpressionCompiler to normalise expressions consisting of addition and subtraction. Such sums are normalised by ensuring left associativity and ordering terms according the the standard expression ordering (ExpressionComparator). Constants are aggregated and terms that appears both positively and negatively are removed. Subterms that use the unary minus operator are also included in the normalisation process. The sum simplifier does not investigate multiplicative subterms, nor does it aggregate subterms that appear more than once into multiplicative terms.

    The sum simplifier includes support for the normalisation of equations that involve sums, which is used by the ConstraintPropagator.

    Author:
    Robi Malik

      • SumSimplifier

        public SumSimplifier(ModuleProxyFactory factory,
                     SimpleExpressionCompiler simplifier)
        Creates a sum simplifier.
        Parameters:
        factory - Factory used to create new expressions.
        simplifier - Compiler used to simplify any subterms outside of the scope of sum normalisation. This argument can be set to null to disable recursive simplification and only perform sum normalisation.

    • Method Detail

      • normaliseSum

        public SimpleExpressionProxy normaliseSum(SimpleExpressionProxy expr)
                                   throws EvalException
        Normalises the given sum.
        Parameters:
        expr - The expression to be normalised, which should be a unary or binary expression with operator + or -.
        Returns:
        The simplified expression. If the expression could not be simplified, then the argument is returned.
        Throws:
        EvalException

      • isNormalisedEquation

        public boolean isNormalisedEquation(SimpleExpressionProxy lhs,
                                    SimpleExpressionProxy rhs,
                                    Comparator<SimpleExpressionProxy> leadTermComparator)
                             throws EvalException
        Checks whether an equation is in normalised form. This method is used by the ConstraintPropagator to determine whether an equation of the form x = sum is in normalised form. The equation is normalised, if the right-hand side sum is normalised, and the left-hand-side x is either a constant and there are no constants in the right-hand side, or precedes all terms in the right hand side based on the given ordering.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The left-hand side x of the equation.
        rhs - The right-hand side sum of the equation.
        leadTermComparator - The comparator to determine the lead term.
        Returns:
        true if the equation is already normalised, false otherwise. A return value of true means that a call to normaliseEquation() will return a changed equation.
        Throws:
        EvalException

      • normaliseEquation

        public BinaryExpressionProxy normaliseEquation(SimpleExpressionProxy lhs,
                                               SimpleExpressionProxy rhs,
                                               BinaryOperator op,
                                               Comparator<SimpleExpressionProxy> leadTermComparator)
                                        throws EvalException
        Normalises an equation. An equation of the form lhs = rhs, where the compared terms lhs and rhs are sums, is normalised by extracting the lead term, which is either a constant or the smallest term in the given ordering that would appear exactly once in the normalised equation, and rewriting the equation into the form x = new-rhs.
        Parameters:
        lhs - The left-hand side of the equation.
        rhs - The right-hand side of the equation.
        op - The equation operator, which should be either == or !=. Greater-than and less-than are not yet fully supported.
        leadTermComparator - The comparator to determine the lead term.
        Returns:
        The normalised sum. This method always returns a new object; please use isNormalisedEquation() to check whether normalisation will result in change.
        Throws:
        EvalException
